info.name: Flight
info.attribution:
The room layout and game design are by LawDawg96 and are released to the Public Domain under CC0.

The following items are available under the Pixabay license:

Bird card background texture: https://pixabay.com/photos/paper-old-texture-parchment-1074131/
Bonus card (gear) back face: https://pixabay.com/illustrations/gears-wallpaper-banner-header-1311171/
Bonus card (feather) back face https://pixabay.com/photos/wing-feather-bird-macaw-parrot-6861729/
Skull and crossbones icon: https://pixabay.com/vectors/skull-and-crossbones-skull-30325/
Birdhouse: https://pixabay.com/vectors/birdhouse-aviary-house-home-bird-48965/
Purple sky background on scoresheet: https://pixabay.com/photos/palm-trees-miami-venice-beach-beach-2203737/
Room (feather) background: https://pixabay.com/photos/ostrich-feather-feather-strauss-1457994/

The following items are available as CC BY 3.0:

Flying bird profile icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/peace-dove.html
Feather icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/feather.html
Wing icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/feathered-wing.html
Next eggs icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/nest-eggs.html
Egg clutch icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/egg-clutch.html
Bowl icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/dinosaur-egg.html
Water icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/waves.html
Grass icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/grass.html
Tree icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/pine-tree.html
Fish icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/various-artists/salmon.html
Fruit icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/cherry.html
Rat icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/delapouite/rat.html
Seed icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/sprout.html
Snail icon: https://game-icons.net/1x1/lorc/snail.html

The following items are available as CC BY-NC 4.0:

The bird card (feather) back face was generated using the Midjourney artificial intelligence image generator, https://www.midjourney.com/home/, using the following prompt: "bright, colorful bunch of feathers on a black background, fancy details, illustrated manuscript --ar 2:3"

All bird sketches were created using Midjourney using a prompt similar to: "[name of bird] perched on a branch, colored pencil drawing on plain parchment background, highly realistic, detailed, scientific nature journal style, side view, beak, wing, feathers, feet". The bird sketches are only rough approximations of what the actual birds look like.

The forest/grassland/wetland background image on the player mat was created using the following Midjourney prompt: "landscape photograph:: 8k:: green forest of pine trees in background:: yellow grassland:: blue pond in foreground:: daylight:: --v 4".
info.description: Spend food and egg token to play bird cards in one of 3 habitats on your board. Collect birds with similar traits and use powers on bird cards to take actions to gain more points. Most points after 4 rounds wins.

info.helpText:
Players sit in seat. Press Start button in bottom-right corner and select from the options to begin. A random player is chosen to begin. Drag and drop cards, food, eggs, and action cubes on to the main player mat as needed. To tuck a bird card, just drop it in the holder. Once you tuck a card, those cards and pile become unmovable for the remainder of the game so that scoring routines work properly.

You can view other players' mats and food tokens (but not cards) by pressing on the eye icon below each seat. The small text below the seat shows which player's mat that seat is viewing. Viewing another seat prevents you out from taking most other actions except changing the view again. When looking at another seat, clicking anywhere on the board will automatically return the view to your own mat.

Place dice removed from the birdfeeder in the area above the 3 common bird cards and the used dice can be rolled as a group by pressing the roll button. The refill button will recall and roll all 5 dice. The discard holder in the bottom-right corner can be used for both bird cards and bonus cards.

At the end of a round, drag an action cube for each player to the green or blue end-of-round board. Once the correct number of cubes are placed into holders on that board, the button to start the next round will display in the bottom-right corner.

Scorekeeping is automatic in all rounds except in round 4, players must calculate and enter their own scores for bonus cards. Use the + and - buttons that display at the end of round 4.

The bird icon near the seat indicates the starting player. During a round, you can change the glow indicator on the seat by pressing the turn button in the bottom-right corner. This will also refill the common cards holder with 3 cards if needed. At the end of each round, the bird icon will advance to the next player automatically.

For solo mode, sit in the far left seat (seat #1). The automa cards and other objects are at the top of the screen. The automa uses maroon action cubes. Place the cubes on the goal cards for the current round. At the end of the round, move one of the cubes into the green (or blue) end-of-round goal scoring cards just like you move your own cube. For the automa, use the end-of-round goal card that covers the scoresheet for seats 3-5. Eggs should be placed in the small holder below the maroon action cubes. All scoring for the automa is automatically calculated.

The automa's actions are not automated. You must manually move cards and other objects in accordance with the rules. At the beginning of each round, the automa's action cards will be set up for the round, but during each turn, you must flip over a new card.

Acorn Woodpecker.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Gain 1 seed from the birdfeeder (if available). You may cache it on this card.

American Avocet.power: ONCE BETWEEN TURNS: When another player takes the lay eggs action, this bird lays 1 egg on another bird with a ground nest.

American Bittern.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Player(s) with the fewest water habitat birds draw 1 bird card.

American Coot.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Tuck a bird card from your hand behind this bird. If you do, draw 1 bird card.

American Crow.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Discard 1 egg from any of your other birds to gain 1 food of your choice from the supply.

American Goldfinch.power: WHEN PLAYED: Gain 3 seeds from the supply.

American Kestrel.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Roll all dice not in birdfeeder. If any are rodents, gain 1 rodent and cache it on this card.

American Oystercatcher.power: WHEN PLAYED: Draw bird cards equal to number of players +1. Starting with you and going clockwise, each player selects 1 of those cards and adds it to their hand. You keep the extra.

American Robin.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Tuck a bird card from your hand behind this card. If you do, draw 1 bird card.

American White Pelican.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Discard 1 fish to tuck 2 bird cards from the deck behind this bird.

Anhinga.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Roll all dice not in birdfeeder. If any are fish, gain 1 fish and cache it on this card.

Anna's Hummingbird.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Each player gains 1 dice from the birdfeeder, starting with the player of your choice.

Ash-Throated Flycatcher.power: WHEN PLAYED: Lay 1 egg on each of your birds with a cavity nest.

Atlantic Puffin.power: WHEN PLAYED: Draw 2 new bonus cards and keep 1.

Baird's Sparrow.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Lay 1 egg on any bird.

Bald Eagle.power: WHEN PLAYED: Gain all fish that are in the birdfeeder.

Baltimore Oriole.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: All players gain 1 fruit from the supply.

Barn Owl.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Roll all dice not in birdfeeder. If any are rodents, gain 1 rodent and cache it on this card.

Barn Swallow.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Tuck a bird card from your hand behind this bird. If you do, draw 1 bird card.

Barred Owl.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Look at a bird card from the deck. If <75cm, tuck it behind this card. If not, discard it.

Barrow's Goldeneye.power: ONCE BETWEEN TURNS: When another player takes the lay eggs action, this bird lays 1 egg on another bird with a cavity nest.

Bell's Vireo.power: WHEN PLAYED: Draw 2 new bonus cards and keep 1.

Belted Kingfisher.power: ONCE BETWEEN TURNS: When another player plays a water habitat bird, gain 1 fish from the supply.

Bewick's Wren.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: If this bird is to the right of all other birds in its habitat, move it to another habitat.

Black Skimmer.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Roll all dice not in birdfeeder. If any are fish, gain 1 fish and cache it on this card.

Black Tern.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Draw 1 bird card. If you do, discard 1 bird card from your hand at the end of your turn.

Black Vulture.power: ONCE BETWEEN TURNS: When another players predator action succeeds, gain 1 dice from the birdfeeder.

Black-Bellied Whistling-Duck.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Discard 1 seed to tuck 2 bird cards from the deck behind this bird.

Black-Billed Magpie.power: ONCE BETWEEN TURNS: When another players predator action succeeds, gain 1 dice drom the birdfeeder.

Black-Crowned Night-Heron.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Discard 1 egg from any of your other birds to gain 1 food of your choice from the supply.

Blue Grosbeak.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: If this bird is to the right of all other birds in its habitat, move it to another habitat.

Blue Jay.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Gain 1 seed from the birdfeeder (if available). You may cache it on this card.

Blue-Gray Gnatcatcher.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Gain 1 invertebrate from the supply.

Bobolink.power: WHEN PLAYED: Lay 1 egg on each of your birds with a ground nest.

Brewer's Blackbird.power: WHEN ACTIVATED: Tuck a bird card from your hand behind this bird. If you do, also lay 1 egg on this bird.

Bronzed Cowbird.power: ONCE BETWEEN TURNS: When another player takes the lay eggs action, this bird lays 1 egg on another bird with a bowl nest.

Brown Pelican.power: WHEN PLAYED: Gain 3 fish from the supply.

parentGlobalUpdateRoutine: var isIn = ${PROPERTY parent} in ${PROPERTY matListArray OF birdDeck}

Anatomist.bonus: Birds with body parts in their names
Anatomist.noteText: Body parts include beak, belly, bill, breast, cap, chin, collar, crest, crown, eye, face, head, neck, rump, shoulder, tail, throat, wing

Breeding Manager.bonus: Birds with at least 4 eggs laid on them

Cartographer.bonus: Birds with geography terms in their name
Cartographer.noteText: Terms include American, Atlantic, Baltimore, California, Canada, Carolina, Chihuhua, Eastern, Inca, Mississippi, Mountain, Northern, Prairie, Sandhill, Savannah, Western

Ecologist.bonus: Birds in your habitat with the fewest birds

Enclosure Builder.noteText: Birds must have a ground or star nest symbol

Forester.bonus: Birds that can only live in forest

Historian.noteText: Any bird with an s in its name

Nest Box Builder.noteText: Birds must have a cavity or star nest symbol

Omnivore Specialist.noteText: Any bird that specifically has a wild symbol as part of its food cost

Oologist.bonus: Birds with at least 1 egg laid on them

Passerine Specialist.bonus: Birds with wingspans 30 cm or less

Photographer.bonus: Birds with colors in their names
Photographer.noteText: Colors include ash, black, blue, bronze, brown, cerulean, chestnut, ferruginous, gold, gray, green, indigo, lazuli, purple, red, rose, roseate, ruby, ruddy, rufous, snowy, violet, white, yellow

Platform Builder.noteText: Birds must have a platform or star nest symbol

Prairie Manager.bonus: Birds that can only live in grassland

Visionary Leader.bonus: Bird cards in hand at end of game

Wetland Scientist.bonus: Birds that can only live in wetland

Wildlife Gardener.noteText: Birds must have a bowl or star nest symbol

If playing solo mode, do you want to include the expert level card?
If playing solo mode, choose difficulty level (4 is normal).
